items.title: Bondi victim Matilda's parents doubt hate laws will prevent future violence
items.description: In their first wide-ranging interview, the parents of 10-year-old Matilda, the youngest victim of the Bondi attack, say the federal government's hate laws offer little reassurance that another terror attack will be prevented.

items.title: Former Labor strategist Tim Picton dies after alleged assault
items.description: Former Labor strategist Tim Picton dies in hospital, weeks after he was allegedly assaulted outside a Perth nightclub.

items.title: Breaking: Young surfer uninjured after shark bites board at Sydney beach
items.description: Surf Life Saving NSW confirmed the boy was unharmed after an encounter with a shark at Dee Why Beach just before lunchtime on Monday.

items.title: Author's lawyer serves second concerns notice to SA Premier
items.description: Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah says her lawyer has served a second concerns notice for defamation on South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas.

items.title: Calls to tax super-rich more as number of global billionaires hits record
items.description: Oxfam Australia is calling on the federal government to tax the super rich to help tackle growing inequality, as billionaires grow their wealth by more than half a million a day on average.

items.title: Live: Aussie wildcard reaches second round as opponent forced off in wheelchair
items.description: Australian wildcard Priscilla Hon gets her first main draw singles win at Melbourne Park since 2020 as Marina Stakusic succumbs to cramps, while men's sixth seed Alex de Minaur starts his grand slam campaign on Rod Laver Arena. Follow live.

items.title: 'I am still trembling': At least 21 dead after high-speed train crash in Spain
items.description: At least 21 people have died and 25 others are severely injured after two high-speed trains derailed in southern Spain, local authorities say.

items.title: The Lion King co-director Roger Allers dies aged 76
items.description: Roger Allers was known for working on various Disney films including The Lion King, The Little Mermaid and Aladdin.

items.title: Why Donald Trump could exploit the US's 250th birthday for his own gain
items.description: The United States of America is celebrating the 250th anniversary of its union as a nation and experts say Donald Trump appears to be exploiting the events for his own political gain.

items.title: US tariff threats over European troop deployments: Here's the latest on Greenland
items.description: Tensions between the United States and Greenland's allies reach a new high, with threats of increasing tariffs after European troops were sent to the island.

items.title: Live: China's economy hits target, growing 5 per cent in 2025
items.description: The ASX is on edge after a renewed escalation on trade tensions between the US and Europe. China's GDP comes in better than forecast but other data is mixed. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: Melbourne goes from among the most to least expensive capital cities
items.description: Property analysts say a mix of economic conditions, policy settings and demographic shifts are among the reasons for the city's subdued dwelling price growth in the past five years.

items.title: AI is ethical, social and economic nightmare and we're starting to wake up
items.description: As 2025 began, I thought humanity's biggest problem was climate change. In 2026, AI is more pressing.

items.title: Deadly Chile wildfires trigger state of catastrophe
items.description: Wildfires raging across central and southern Chile have left at least 18 people dead, scorched thousands of hectares of forest and destroyed hundreds of homes, local authorities say, as the South American country swelters under a heat wave.

items.title: Smith speaks on T20 future ahead of World Cup
items.description: Steve Smith has lit up the Big Bash since returning to the Sydney Sixers, but has concedes the ship has sailed for him to play in next month's T20 World Cup.

items.title: Rain event helped create 'perfect storm' for shark attack, authorities say
items.description: Police say the boy was pulled aboard a vessel by water police officers "within minutes" of the Triple Zero call being made.

items.title: Quiz: Can you conquer this week's history questions?
items.description: Trips to the moon and Mars, same-sex marriage and the first canned beer appear in this week's line-up.

items.title: Dingoes 'had been in contact' with deceased woman's body on K'gari beach
items.description: Police say the woman was working at a backpacker's hostel and went for an early morning swim.

items.title: Man accused of planting pipe bombs along Canberra footpaths faces court
items.description: Damien Paul O'Brien was arrested in Gungahlin on Saturday night after officers attached to ACT Policing allegedly found items used to assemble pipe bombs during a search of his Belconnen home earlier in the day.

items.title: Police seize 100kg cannabis, guns in Townsville drug trafficking arrest
items.description: Police find 100kg cannabis, 8kg of methamphetamine and 1kg of cocaine as well as illegal firearms hidden in bush at a Townsville property.

items.title: Three charged over teenager's alleged drive-by shooting death
items.description: Sixteen-year-old Ater Good died after being found by officers who heard gunshots near the Fitzroy Police Station earlier this month.

items.title: What psychologists have to say about the seven types of rest
items.description: Have you ever found yourself still exhausted and deflated after an eight-hour sleep? Perhaps sleep isn't the reset you need.

items.title: ASX-listed company on brink of collapse buries whistleblower complaint
items.description: An investigation into whistleblower allegations finds senior managers at a NSW coal mine were involved in a decision by the mine to award their own companies multi-million-dollar contracts.

items.title: Life in Cuba is about to get harder as Trump threatens oil supply
items.description: Many experts are predicting life in Cuba is about to get even harder.

items.title: Company director sentenced for interfering with Aboriginal relics
items.description: Graeme Elphinstone, the founder and director of Elphinstone Engineering, avoided conviction and was fined $12,000 for interfering with Aboriginal relics on his land on Tasmania's east coast.
